While this model carries a $150 MSRP, you’re never likely to pay full price as it’s regularly cut down to $110 a lot of the time, with discounts having taken things lower to $90, $80, and the one-time $75 low back in July. You’re getting another chance at the second-best pricing we have tracked, which gives you a handy means to keep personal devices running with $70 cut from the MSRP.
